title: 110_s2147
content:
The Act titled "Security Contractor Accountability Act of 2007" addresses the legal status of contract personnel. The Military Extraterritorial Jurisdiction Act is amended to include contractors employed under US government contracts in areas where the Armed Forces are conducting contingency operations. The Military Extraterritorial Jurisdiction Act is amended to include contractors employed under US government contracts in areas where the Armed Forces are conducting contingency operations. The Department of Justice Inspector General must submit a report to Congress within 180 days detailing investigations of alleged violations of section 3261 of title 18, United States Code, by contract personnel. The Department of Justice Inspector General must submit a report to Congress within 180 days detailing investigations into complaints, criminal cases opened and closed, findings, and recommendations regarding criminal cases prosecuted involving violations of section 3261 of title 18, United States Code. The report should be in unclassified format but may include a classified annex if necessary. SEC. 3. FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION INVESTIGATIVE UNIT FOR CONTINGENCY OPERATIONS. Establishment of Theater Investigative Unit to investigate criminal violations by contract personnel in theater of operations, including reports of misconduct and fatalities, with cases referred to the Attorney General for further action. The Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation is responsible for ensuring adequate resources for Theater Investigative Units and notifying Congress of their establishment or termination. Other federal agencies operating in or near areas where the Armed Forces are conducting operations must cooperate with and support the activities of the Theater Investigative Unit. Coordination with Inspector General investigations is required. The Inspector General of an agency must coordinate with the Theater Investigative Unit as necessary. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, a "covered contract" refers to a prime contract, subcontract, or task order carried out outside the US during a contingency operation by an agency as defined in section 105 of title 5, US Code. In section 105 of title 5, US Code, the term "Executive agency" is defined. The term "contingency operation" is defined in section 101(13) of title 10, US Code. A "contractor" is an entity performing a covered contract, and "contract personnel" are individuals assigned by a contractor to work under a covered contract. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE.

This Act applies to covered contracts and personnel in areas where the Armed Forces are conducting a contingency operation. The Act takes immediate effect upon enactment and agencies have 90 days to ensure compliance.
